description: European music is most famous for its classical tradition, but it also has a vast and vibrant tapestry of folk and traditional music that varies greatly from region to region.

regions.name: Celtic
regions.description: The folk music of Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Brittany, and Galicia. Characterized by dance tunes like jigs and reels, and narrative ballads.

regions.name: Balkan
regions.description: Known for its complex, often asymmetrical rhythms (aksak rhythm) and emotional melodies. Brass bands (trubači) are a famous feature.
traditions: Bulgarian State Television Female Vocal Choir

regions.name: Nordic/Scandinavian
regions.description: The folk music of the Nordic countries, with traditions of fiddle playing (Hardingfele in Norway), herding calls (Kulning), and epic poetry (Kalevala in Finland).

regions.name: Eastern Europe
regions.description: A diverse region with strong choral traditions, folk dances like the Polka and Mazurka, and unique instrumental music, including Klezmer.

regions.name: Mediterranean
regions.description: Includes traditions like Italian Tarantella, Greek Rebetiko, and Portuguese Fado. Often characterized by passionate vocals and string instruments.
